interfaces.data_exchange.serializers¶

Source: src\interfaces\data_exchange\serializers.py

Module Overview¶

Core serialization framework with multiple format support. This module provides efficient serializers for various data formats including JSON, MessagePack, Pickle, and custom binary formats with compression and performance optimization capabilities.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#==================== src/interfaces/data_exchange/serializers.py =====================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Core serialization framework with multiple format support.
  7This module provides efficient serializers for various data formats
  8including JSON, MessagePack, Pickle, and custom binary formats
  9with compression and performance optimization capabilities.
 10"""
 11
 12import json
 13import pickle
 14import gzip
 15import zlib
 16from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
 17from typing import Any, Dict, Optional, Union, Type, TypeVar
 18from enum import Enum
 19import logging
 20import time
 21
 22try:
 23    import msgpack
 24    MSGPACK_AVAILABLE = True
 25except ImportError:
 26    MSGPACK_AVAILABLE = False
 27
 28try:
 29    import lz4.frame
 30    LZ4_AVAILABLE = True
 31except ImportError:
 32    LZ4_AVAILABLE = False
 33
 34try:
 35    import zstandard as zstd
 36    ZSTD_AVAILABLE = True
 37except ImportError:
 38    ZSTD_AVAILABLE = False
 39
 40from .data_types import SerializableData, DataMessage, CompressionType
 41
 42T = TypeVar('T')
 43
 44
 45class SerializationFormat(Enum):
 46    """Supported serialization formats."""
 47    JSON = "json"
 48    MSGPACK = "msgpack"
 49    PICKLE = "pickle"
 50    BINARY = "binary"
 51    JSON_COMPRESSED = "json_compressed"
 52    MSGPACK_COMPRESSED = "msgpack_compressed"
 53
 54
 55class SerializationError(Exception):
 56    """Exception raised during serialization/deserialization."""
 57
 58    def __init__(self, message: str, format_type: SerializationFormat,
 59                 original_error: Optional[Exception] = None):
 60        super().__init__(message)
 61        self.format_type = format_type
 62        self.original_error = original_error
 63
 64
 65class SerializerInterface(ABC):
 66    """Abstract interface for serializers."""
 67
 68    @abstractmethod
 69    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
 70        """Serialize data to bytes."""
 71        pass
 72
 73    @abstractmethod
 74    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
 75        """Deserialize bytes to data."""
 76        pass
 77
 78    @property
 79    @abstractmethod
 80    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
 81        """Get serialization format type."""
 82        pass
 83
 84    @property
 85    @abstractmethod
 86    def content_type(self) -> str:
 87        """Get MIME content type."""
 88        pass
 89
 90    def get_compression_ratio(self, original_data: Any) -> float:
 91        """Calculate compression ratio."""
 92        try:
 93            original_size = len(pickle.dumps(original_data))
 94            compressed_size = len(self.serialize(original_data))
 95            return original_size / compressed_size if compressed_size > 0 else 1.0
 96        except Exception:
 97            return 1.0
 98
 99
100class JSONSerializer(SerializerInterface):
101    """JSON serialization with custom encoder support."""
102
103    def __init__(self, ensure_ascii: bool = False, sort_keys: bool = False,
104                 indent: Optional[int] = None, compact: bool = True):
105        self._ensure_ascii = ensure_ascii
106        self._sort_keys = sort_keys
107        self._indent = None if compact else (indent or 2)
108        self._separators = (',', ':') if compact else None
109
110    @property
111    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
112        return SerializationFormat.JSON
113
114    @property
115    def content_type(self) -> str:
116        return "application/json"
117
118    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
119        """Serialize data to JSON bytes."""
120        try:
121            # Convert SerializableData to dict
122            if isinstance(data, SerializableData):
123                json_data = data.to_dict()
124            elif isinstance(data, DataMessage):
125                json_data = data.to_dict()
126            elif hasattr(data, 'to_dict'):
127                json_data = data.to_dict()
128            else:
129                json_data = self._prepare_for_json(data)
130
131            json_str = json.dumps(
132                json_data,
133                ensure_ascii=self._ensure_ascii,
134                sort_keys=self._sort_keys,
135                indent=self._indent,
136                separators=self._separators,
137                default=self._json_default
138            )
139            return json_str.encode('utf-8')
140
141        except Exception as e:
142            raise SerializationError(
143                f"JSON serialization failed: {e}",
144                SerializationFormat.JSON,
145                e
146            )
147
148    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
149        """Deserialize JSON bytes to data."""
150        try:
151            json_str = data.decode('utf-8')
152            json_data = json.loads(json_str)
153
154            # Convert back to target type if specified
155            if target_type:
156                if issubclass(target_type, SerializableData):
157                    return target_type.from_dict(json_data)
158                elif issubclass(target_type, DataMessage):
159                    return target_type.from_dict(json_data)
160
161            return self._restore_from_json(json_data)
162
163        except Exception as e:
164            raise SerializationError(
165                f"JSON deserialization failed: {e}",
166                SerializationFormat.JSON,
167                e
168            )
169
170    def _json_default(self, obj: Any) -> Any:
171        """Default JSON encoder for non-serializable objects."""
172        if hasattr(obj, 'to_dict'):
173            return obj.to_dict()
174        elif hasattr(obj, '__dict__'):
175            return obj.__dict__
176        else:
177            return str(obj)
178
179    def _prepare_for_json(self, data: Any) -> Any:
180        """Prepare data for JSON serialization."""
181        return SerializableData._serialize_data(data)
182
183    def _restore_from_json(self, data: Any) -> Any:
184        """Restore data from JSON representation."""
185        return SerializableData._deserialize_data(data)
186
187
188class MessagePackSerializer(SerializerInterface):
189    """MessagePack serialization for efficient binary encoding."""
190
191    def __init__(self, use_bin_type: bool = True, strict_map_key: bool = False):
192        if not MSGPACK_AVAILABLE:
193            raise ImportError("msgpack library not available")
194
195        self._use_bin_type = use_bin_type
196        self._strict_map_key = strict_map_key
197
198    @property
199    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
200        return SerializationFormat.MSGPACK
201
202    @property
203    def content_type(self) -> str:
204        return "application/msgpack"
205
206    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
207        """Serialize data to MessagePack bytes."""
208        try:
209            # Convert to serializable format
210            if isinstance(data, (SerializableData, DataMessage)):
211                pack_data = data.to_dict()
212            elif hasattr(data, 'to_dict'):
213                pack_data = data.to_dict()
214            else:
215                pack_data = SerializableData._serialize_data(data)
216
217            return msgpack.packb(
218                pack_data,
219                use_bin_type=self._use_bin_type,
220                strict_map_key=self._strict_map_key
221            )
222
223        except Exception as e:
224            raise SerializationError(
225                f"MessagePack serialization failed: {e}",
226                SerializationFormat.MSGPACK,
227                e
228            )
229
230    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
231        """Deserialize MessagePack bytes to data."""
232        try:
233            unpacked_data = msgpack.unpackb(data, raw=False, strict_map_key=False)
234
235            # Convert back to target type if specified
236            if target_type:
237                if issubclass(target_type, SerializableData):
238                    return target_type.from_dict(unpacked_data)
239                elif issubclass(target_type, DataMessage):
240                    return target_type.from_dict(unpacked_data)
241
242            return SerializableData._deserialize_data(unpacked_data)
243
244        except Exception as e:
245            raise SerializationError(
246                f"MessagePack deserialization failed: {e}",
247                SerializationFormat.MSGPACK,
248                e
249            )
250
251
252class PickleSerializer(SerializerInterface):
253    """Pickle serialization for Python object preservation."""
254
255    def __init__(self, protocol: int = pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL):
256        self._protocol = protocol
257
258    @property
259    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
260        return SerializationFormat.PICKLE
261
262    @property
263    def content_type(self) -> str:
264        return "application/python-pickle"
265
266    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
267        """Serialize data to pickle bytes."""
268        try:
269            return pickle.dumps(data, protocol=self._protocol)
270        except Exception as e:
271            raise SerializationError(
272                f"Pickle serialization failed: {e}",
273                SerializationFormat.PICKLE,
274                e
275            )
276
277    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
278        """Deserialize pickle bytes to data."""
279        try:
280            return pickle.loads(data)
281        except Exception as e:
282            raise SerializationError(
283                f"Pickle deserialization failed: {e}",
284                SerializationFormat.PICKLE,
285                e
286            )
287
288
289class BinarySerializer(SerializerInterface):
290    """High-performance binary serializer for structured data."""
291
292    def __init__(self):
293        self._struct_cache: Dict[str, Any] = {}
294
295    @property
296    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
297        return SerializationFormat.BINARY
298
299    @property
300    def content_type(self) -> str:
301        return "application/octet-stream"
302
303    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
304        """Serialize data to custom binary format."""
305        try:
306            import struct
307
308            if isinstance(data, (int, float)):
309                # Simple numeric types
310                if isinstance(data, int):
311                    return b'i' + struct.pack('>q', data)  # 8-byte signed int
312                else:
313                    return b'f' + struct.pack('>d', data)  # 8-byte double
314
315            elif isinstance(data, str):
316                # String data
317                str_bytes = data.encode('utf-8')
318                return b's' + struct.pack('>I', len(str_bytes)) + str_bytes
319
320            elif isinstance(data, bytes):
321                # Raw bytes
322                return b'b' + struct.pack('>I', len(data)) + data
323
324            elif isinstance(data, (list, tuple)):
325                # Sequence data
326                result = b'l' + struct.pack('>I', len(data))
327                for item in data:
328                    item_bytes = self.serialize(item)
329                    result += struct.pack('>I', len(item_bytes)) + item_bytes
330                return result
331
332            elif isinstance(data, dict):
333                # Dictionary data
334                result = b'd' + struct.pack('>I', len(data))
335                for key, value in data.items():
336                    key_bytes = self.serialize(key)
337                    value_bytes = self.serialize(value)
338                    result += struct.pack('>II', len(key_bytes), len(value_bytes))
339                    result += key_bytes + value_bytes
340                return result
341
342            else:
343                # Fall back to pickle for complex objects
344                pickled = pickle.dumps(data)
345                return b'p' + struct.pack('>I', len(pickled)) + pickled
346
347        except Exception as e:
348            raise SerializationError(
349                f"Binary serialization failed: {e}",
350                SerializationFormat.BINARY,
351                e
352            )
353
354    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
355        """Deserialize binary data."""
356        try:
357            import struct
358
359            if len(data) < 1:
360                raise ValueError("Empty data")
361
362            type_marker = data[0:1]
363            payload = data[1:]
364
365            if type_marker == b'i':
366                return struct.unpack('>q', payload)[0]
367            elif type_marker == b'f':
368                return struct.unpack('>d', payload)[0]
369            elif type_marker == b's':
370                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
371                return payload[4:4+length].decode('utf-8')
372            elif type_marker == b'b':
373                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
374                return payload[4:4+length]
375            elif type_marker == b'l':
376                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
377                result = []
378                offset = 4
379                for _ in range(length):
380                    item_length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[offset:offset+4])[0]
381                    offset += 4
382                    item_data = payload[offset:offset+item_length]
383                    offset += item_length
384                    result.append(self.deserialize(item_data))
385                return result
386            elif type_marker == b'd':
387                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
388                result = {}
389                offset = 4
390                for _ in range(length):
391                    key_length, value_length = struct.unpack('>II', payload[offset:offset+8])
392                    offset += 8
393                    key_data = payload[offset:offset+key_length]
394                    offset += key_length
395                    value_data = payload[offset:offset+value_length]
396                    offset += value_length
397                    key = self.deserialize(key_data)
398                    value = self.deserialize(value_data)
399                    result[key] = value
400                return result
401            elif type_marker == b'p':
402                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
403                return pickle.loads(payload[4:4+length])
404            else:
405                raise ValueError(f"Unknown type marker: {type_marker}")
406
407        except Exception as e:
408            raise SerializationError(
409                f"Binary deserialization failed: {e}",
410                SerializationFormat.BINARY,
411                e
412            )
413
414
415class CompressionSerializer(SerializerInterface):
416    """Wrapper serializer that adds compression to any base serializer."""
417
418    def __init__(self, base_serializer: SerializerInterface,
419                 compression_type: CompressionType = CompressionType.GZIP,
420                 compression_level: int = 6):
421        self._base_serializer = base_serializer
422        self._compression_type = compression_type
423        self._compression_level = compression_level
424
425        # Validate compression availability
426        if compression_type == CompressionType.LZ4 and not LZ4_AVAILABLE:
427            raise ImportError("lz4 library not available")
428        if compression_type == CompressionType.ZSTD and not ZSTD_AVAILABLE:
429            raise ImportError("zstandard library not available")
430
431    @property
432    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
433        base_format = self._base_serializer.format_type
434        if base_format == SerializationFormat.JSON:
435            return SerializationFormat.JSON_COMPRESSED
436        elif base_format == SerializationFormat.MSGPACK:
437            return SerializationFormat.MSGPACK_COMPRESSED
438        else:
439            return base_format
440
441    @property
442    def content_type(self) -> str:
443        return f"{self._base_serializer.content_type}+{self._compression_type.value}"
444
445    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
446        """Serialize and compress data."""
447        try:
448            # First serialize with base serializer
449            serialized_data = self._base_serializer.serialize(data)
450
451            # Then compress
452            if self._compression_type == CompressionType.GZIP:
453                return gzip.compress(serialized_data, compresslevel=self._compression_level)
454            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZLIB:
455                return zlib.compress(serialized_data, level=self._compression_level)
456            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.LZ4:
457                return lz4.frame.compress(serialized_data, compression_level=self._compression_level)
458            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZSTD:
459                compressor = zstd.ZstdCompressor(level=self._compression_level)
460                return compressor.compress(serialized_data)
461            else:
462                return serialized_data
463
464        except Exception as e:
465            raise SerializationError(
466                f"Compression serialization failed: {e}",
467                self.format_type,
468                e
469            )
470
471    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
472        """Decompress and deserialize data."""
473        try:
474            # First decompress
475            if self._compression_type == CompressionType.GZIP:
476                decompressed_data = gzip.decompress(data)
477            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZLIB:
478                decompressed_data = zlib.decompress(data)
479            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.LZ4:
480                decompressed_data = lz4.frame.decompress(data)
481            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZSTD:
482                decompressor = zstd.ZstdDecompressor()
483                decompressed_data = decompressor.decompress(data)
484            else:
485                decompressed_data = data
486
487            # Then deserialize with base serializer
488            return self._base_serializer.deserialize(decompressed_data, target_type)
489
490        except Exception as e:
491            raise SerializationError(
492                f"Compression deserialization failed: {e}",
493                self.format_type,
494                e
495            )
496
497    def get_compression_stats(self, data: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
498        """Get compression statistics."""
499        try:
500            original_data = self._base_serializer.serialize(data)
501            compressed_data = self.serialize(data)
502
503            return {
504                'original_size': len(original_data),
505                'compressed_size': len(compressed_data),
506                'compression_ratio': len(original_data) / len(compressed_data),
507                'space_savings': (len(original_data) - len(compressed_data)) / len(original_data),
508                'compression_type': self._compression_type.value
509            }
510        except Exception:
511            return {}
512
513
514# Convenience functions for quick serializer creation
515def create_json_serializer(compact: bool = True, ensure_ascii: bool = False) -> JSONSerializer:
516    """Create JSON serializer with common settings."""
517    return JSONSerializer(ensure_ascii=ensure_ascii, compact=compact)
518
519
520def create_msgpack_serializer() -> MessagePackSerializer:
521    """Create MessagePack serializer."""
522    if not MSGPACK_AVAILABLE:
523        raise ImportError("msgpack library not available")
524    return MessagePackSerializer()
525
526
527def create_compressed_serializer(base_format: SerializationFormat = SerializationFormat.JSON,
528                                compression_type: CompressionType = CompressionType.GZIP,
529                                compression_level: int = 6) -> CompressionSerializer:
530    """Create compressed serializer."""
531    if base_format == SerializationFormat.JSON:
532        base_serializer = create_json_serializer()
533    elif base_format == SerializationFormat.MSGPACK:
534        base_serializer = create_msgpack_serializer()
535    elif base_format == SerializationFormat.PICKLE:
536        base_serializer = PickleSerializer()
537    else:
538        base_serializer = BinarySerializer()
539
540    return CompressionSerializer(base_serializer, compression_type, compression_level)

SerializationFormat¶

Inherits from: Enum

Supported serialization formats.

Source Code¶

1class SerializationFormat(Enum):
2    """Supported serialization formats."""
3    JSON = "json"
4    MSGPACK = "msgpack"
5    PICKLE = "pickle"
6    BINARY = "binary"
7    JSON_COMPRESSED = "json_compressed"
8    MSGPACK_COMPRESSED = "msgpack_compressed"

1class SerializationError(Exception):
2    """Exception raised during serialization/deserialization."""
3
4    def __init__(self, message: str, format_type: SerializationFormat,
5                 original_error: Optional[Exception] = None):
6        super().__init__(message)
7        self.format_type = format_type
8        self.original_error = original_error

SerializerInterface¶

Inherits from: ABC

Abstract interface for serializers.

Source Code¶

 1class SerializerInterface(ABC):
 2    """Abstract interface for serializers."""
 3
 4    @abstractmethod
 5    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
 6        """Serialize data to bytes."""
 7        pass
 8
 9    @abstractmethod
10    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
11        """Deserialize bytes to data."""
12        pass
13
14    @property
15    @abstractmethod
16    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
17        """Get serialization format type."""
18        pass
19
20    @property
21    @abstractmethod
22    def content_type(self) -> str:
23        """Get MIME content type."""
24        pass
25
26    def get_compression_ratio(self, original_data: Any) -> float:
27        """Calculate compression ratio."""
28        try:
29            original_size = len(pickle.dumps(original_data))
30            compressed_size = len(self.serialize(original_data))
31            return original_size / compressed_size if compressed_size > 0 else 1.0
32        except Exception:
33            return 1.0

JSONSerializer¶

Inherits from: SerializerInterface

JSON serialization with custom encoder support.

Source Code¶

 1class JSONSerializer(SerializerInterface):
 2    """JSON serialization with custom encoder support."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, ensure_ascii: bool = False, sort_keys: bool = False,
 5                 indent: Optional[int] = None, compact: bool = True):
 6        self._ensure_ascii = ensure_ascii
 7        self._sort_keys = sort_keys
 8        self._indent = None if compact else (indent or 2)
 9        self._separators = (',', ':') if compact else None
10
11    @property
12    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
13        return SerializationFormat.JSON
14
15    @property
16    def content_type(self) -> str:
17        return "application/json"
18
19    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
20        """Serialize data to JSON bytes."""
21        try:
22            # Convert SerializableData to dict
23            if isinstance(data, SerializableData):
24                json_data = data.to_dict()
25            elif isinstance(data, DataMessage):
26                json_data = data.to_dict()
27            elif hasattr(data, 'to_dict'):
28                json_data = data.to_dict()
29            else:
30                json_data = self._prepare_for_json(data)
31
32            json_str = json.dumps(
33                json_data,
34                ensure_ascii=self._ensure_ascii,
35                sort_keys=self._sort_keys,
36                indent=self._indent,
37                separators=self._separators,
38                default=self._json_default
39            )
40            return json_str.encode('utf-8')
41
42        except Exception as e:
43            raise SerializationError(
44                f"JSON serialization failed: {e}",
45                SerializationFormat.JSON,
46                e
47            )
48
49    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
50        """Deserialize JSON bytes to data."""
51        try:
52            json_str = data.decode('utf-8')
53            json_data = json.loads(json_str)
54
55            # Convert back to target type if specified
56            if target_type:
57                if issubclass(target_type, SerializableData):
58                    return target_type.from_dict(json_data)
59                elif issubclass(target_type, DataMessage):
60                    return target_type.from_dict(json_data)
61
62            return self._restore_from_json(json_data)
63
64        except Exception as e:
65            raise SerializationError(
66                f"JSON deserialization failed: {e}",
67                SerializationFormat.JSON,
68                e
69            )
70
71    def _json_default(self, obj: Any) -> Any:
72        """Default JSON encoder for non-serializable objects."""
73        if hasattr(obj, 'to_dict'):
74            return obj.to_dict()
75        elif hasattr(obj, '__dict__'):
76            return obj.__dict__
77        else:
78            return str(obj)
79
80    def _prepare_for_json(self, data: Any) -> Any:
81        """Prepare data for JSON serialization."""
82        return SerializableData._serialize_data(data)
83
84    def _restore_from_json(self, data: Any) -> Any:
85        """Restore data from JSON representation."""
86        return SerializableData._deserialize_data(data)

MessagePackSerializer¶

Inherits from: SerializerInterface

MessagePack serialization for efficient binary encoding.

Source Code¶

 1class MessagePackSerializer(SerializerInterface):
 2    """MessagePack serialization for efficient binary encoding."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, use_bin_type: bool = True, strict_map_key: bool = False):
 5        if not MSGPACK_AVAILABLE:
 6            raise ImportError("msgpack library not available")
 7
 8        self._use_bin_type = use_bin_type
 9        self._strict_map_key = strict_map_key
10
11    @property
12    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
13        return SerializationFormat.MSGPACK
14
15    @property
16    def content_type(self) -> str:
17        return "application/msgpack"
18
19    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
20        """Serialize data to MessagePack bytes."""
21        try:
22            # Convert to serializable format
23            if isinstance(data, (SerializableData, DataMessage)):
24                pack_data = data.to_dict()
25            elif hasattr(data, 'to_dict'):
26                pack_data = data.to_dict()
27            else:
28                pack_data = SerializableData._serialize_data(data)
29
30            return msgpack.packb(
31                pack_data,
32                use_bin_type=self._use_bin_type,
33                strict_map_key=self._strict_map_key
34            )
35
36        except Exception as e:
37            raise SerializationError(
38                f"MessagePack serialization failed: {e}",
39                SerializationFormat.MSGPACK,
40                e
41            )
42
43    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
44        """Deserialize MessagePack bytes to data."""
45        try:
46            unpacked_data = msgpack.unpackb(data, raw=False, strict_map_key=False)
47
48            # Convert back to target type if specified
49            if target_type:
50                if issubclass(target_type, SerializableData):
51                    return target_type.from_dict(unpacked_data)
52                elif issubclass(target_type, DataMessage):
53                    return target_type.from_dict(unpacked_data)
54
55            return SerializableData._deserialize_data(unpacked_data)
56
57        except Exception as e:
58            raise SerializationError(
59                f"MessagePack deserialization failed: {e}",
60                SerializationFormat.MSGPACK,
61                e
62            )

PickleSerializer¶

Inherits from: SerializerInterface

Pickle serialization for Python object preservation.

Source Code¶

 1class PickleSerializer(SerializerInterface):
 2    """Pickle serialization for Python object preservation."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, protocol: int = pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL):
 5        self._protocol = protocol
 6
 7    @property
 8    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
 9        return SerializationFormat.PICKLE
10
11    @property
12    def content_type(self) -> str:
13        return "application/python-pickle"
14
15    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
16        """Serialize data to pickle bytes."""
17        try:
18            return pickle.dumps(data, protocol=self._protocol)
19        except Exception as e:
20            raise SerializationError(
21                f"Pickle serialization failed: {e}",
22                SerializationFormat.PICKLE,
23                e
24            )
25
26    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
27        """Deserialize pickle bytes to data."""
28        try:
29            return pickle.loads(data)
30        except Exception as e:
31            raise SerializationError(
32                f"Pickle deserialization failed: {e}",
33                SerializationFormat.PICKLE,
34                e
35            )

BinarySerializer¶

Inherits from: SerializerInterface

High-performance binary serializer for structured data.

Source Code¶

  1class BinarySerializer(SerializerInterface):
  2    """High-performance binary serializer for structured data."""
  3
  4    def __init__(self):
  5        self._struct_cache: Dict[str, Any] = {}
  6
  7    @property
  8    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
  9        return SerializationFormat.BINARY
 10
 11    @property
 12    def content_type(self) -> str:
 13        return "application/octet-stream"
 14
 15    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
 16        """Serialize data to custom binary format."""
 17        try:
 18            import struct
 19
 20            if isinstance(data, (int, float)):
 21                # Simple numeric types
 22                if isinstance(data, int):
 23                    return b'i' + struct.pack('>q', data)  # 8-byte signed int
 24                else:
 25                    return b'f' + struct.pack('>d', data)  # 8-byte double
 26
 27            elif isinstance(data, str):
 28                # String data
 29                str_bytes = data.encode('utf-8')
 30                return b's' + struct.pack('>I', len(str_bytes)) + str_bytes
 31
 32            elif isinstance(data, bytes):
 33                # Raw bytes
 34                return b'b' + struct.pack('>I', len(data)) + data
 35
 36            elif isinstance(data, (list, tuple)):
 37                # Sequence data
 38                result = b'l' + struct.pack('>I', len(data))
 39                for item in data:
 40                    item_bytes = self.serialize(item)
 41                    result += struct.pack('>I', len(item_bytes)) + item_bytes
 42                return result
 43
 44            elif isinstance(data, dict):
 45                # Dictionary data
 46                result = b'd' + struct.pack('>I', len(data))
 47                for key, value in data.items():
 48                    key_bytes = self.serialize(key)
 49                    value_bytes = self.serialize(value)
 50                    result += struct.pack('>II', len(key_bytes), len(value_bytes))
 51                    result += key_bytes + value_bytes
 52                return result
 53
 54            else:
 55                # Fall back to pickle for complex objects
 56                pickled = pickle.dumps(data)
 57                return b'p' + struct.pack('>I', len(pickled)) + pickled
 58
 59        except Exception as e:
 60            raise SerializationError(
 61                f"Binary serialization failed: {e}",
 62                SerializationFormat.BINARY,
 63                e
 64            )
 65
 66    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
 67        """Deserialize binary data."""
 68        try:
 69            import struct
 70
 71            if len(data) < 1:
 72                raise ValueError("Empty data")
 73
 74            type_marker = data[0:1]
 75            payload = data[1:]
 76
 77            if type_marker == b'i':
 78                return struct.unpack('>q', payload)[0]
 79            elif type_marker == b'f':
 80                return struct.unpack('>d', payload)[0]
 81            elif type_marker == b's':
 82                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
 83                return payload[4:4+length].decode('utf-8')
 84            elif type_marker == b'b':
 85                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
 86                return payload[4:4+length]
 87            elif type_marker == b'l':
 88                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
 89                result = []
 90                offset = 4
 91                for _ in range(length):
 92                    item_length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[offset:offset+4])[0]
 93                    offset += 4
 94                    item_data = payload[offset:offset+item_length]
 95                    offset += item_length
 96                    result.append(self.deserialize(item_data))
 97                return result
 98            elif type_marker == b'd':
 99                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
100                result = {}
101                offset = 4
102                for _ in range(length):
103                    key_length, value_length = struct.unpack('>II', payload[offset:offset+8])
104                    offset += 8
105                    key_data = payload[offset:offset+key_length]
106                    offset += key_length
107                    value_data = payload[offset:offset+value_length]
108                    offset += value_length
109                    key = self.deserialize(key_data)
110                    value = self.deserialize(value_data)
111                    result[key] = value
112                return result
113            elif type_marker == b'p':
114                length = struct.unpack('>I', payload[:4])[0]
115                return pickle.loads(payload[4:4+length])
116            else:
117                raise ValueError(f"Unknown type marker: {type_marker}")
118
119        except Exception as e:
120            raise SerializationError(
121                f"Binary deserialization failed: {e}",
122                SerializationFormat.BINARY,
123                e
124            )

CompressionSerializer¶

Inherits from: SerializerInterface

Wrapper serializer that adds compression to any base serializer.

Source Code¶

 1class CompressionSerializer(SerializerInterface):
 2    """Wrapper serializer that adds compression to any base serializer."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, base_serializer: SerializerInterface,
 5                 compression_type: CompressionType = CompressionType.GZIP,
 6                 compression_level: int = 6):
 7        self._base_serializer = base_serializer
 8        self._compression_type = compression_type
 9        self._compression_level = compression_level
10
11        # Validate compression availability
12        if compression_type == CompressionType.LZ4 and not LZ4_AVAILABLE:
13            raise ImportError("lz4 library not available")
14        if compression_type == CompressionType.ZSTD and not ZSTD_AVAILABLE:
15            raise ImportError("zstandard library not available")
16
17    @property
18    def format_type(self) -> SerializationFormat:
19        base_format = self._base_serializer.format_type
20        if base_format == SerializationFormat.JSON:
21            return SerializationFormat.JSON_COMPRESSED
22        elif base_format == SerializationFormat.MSGPACK:
23            return SerializationFormat.MSGPACK_COMPRESSED
24        else:
25            return base_format
26
27    @property
28    def content_type(self) -> str:
29        return f"{self._base_serializer.content_type}+{self._compression_type.value}"
30
31    def serialize(self, data: Any) -> bytes:
32        """Serialize and compress data."""
33        try:
34            # First serialize with base serializer
35            serialized_data = self._base_serializer.serialize(data)
36
37            # Then compress
38            if self._compression_type == CompressionType.GZIP:
39                return gzip.compress(serialized_data, compresslevel=self._compression_level)
40            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZLIB:
41                return zlib.compress(serialized_data, level=self._compression_level)
42            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.LZ4:
43                return lz4.frame.compress(serialized_data, compression_level=self._compression_level)
44            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZSTD:
45                compressor = zstd.ZstdCompressor(level=self._compression_level)
46                return compressor.compress(serialized_data)
47            else:
48                return serialized_data
49
50        except Exception as e:
51            raise SerializationError(
52                f"Compression serialization failed: {e}",
53                self.format_type,
54                e
55            )
56
57    def deserialize(self, data: bytes, target_type: Optional[Type[T]] = None) -> T:
58        """Decompress and deserialize data."""
59        try:
60            # First decompress
61            if self._compression_type == CompressionType.GZIP:
62                decompressed_data = gzip.decompress(data)
63            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZLIB:
64                decompressed_data = zlib.decompress(data)
65            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.LZ4:
66                decompressed_data = lz4.frame.decompress(data)
67            elif self._compression_type == CompressionType.ZSTD:
68                decompressor = zstd.ZstdDecompressor()
69                decompressed_data = decompressor.decompress(data)
70            else:
71                decompressed_data = data
72
73            # Then deserialize with base serializer
74            return self._base_serializer.deserialize(decompressed_data, target_type)
75
76        except Exception as e:
77            raise SerializationError(
78                f"Compression deserialization failed: {e}",
79                self.format_type,
80                e
81            )
82
83    def get_compression_stats(self, data: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
84        """Get compression statistics."""
85        try:
86            original_data = self._base_serializer.serialize(data)
87            compressed_data = self.serialize(data)
88
89            return {
90                'original_size': len(original_data),
91                'compressed_size': len(compressed_data),
92                'compression_ratio': len(original_data) / len(compressed_data),
93                'space_savings': (len(original_data) - len(compressed_data)) / len(original_data),
94                'compression_type': self._compression_type.value
95            }
96        except Exception:
97            return {}

create_compressed_serializer(base_format, compression_type, compression_level)¶

Create compressed serializer.

Source Code¶

 1def create_compressed_serializer(base_format: SerializationFormat = SerializationFormat.JSON,
 2                                compression_type: CompressionType = CompressionType.GZIP,
 3                                compression_level: int = 6) -> CompressionSerializer:
 4    """Create compressed serializer."""
 5    if base_format == SerializationFormat.JSON:
 6        base_serializer = create_json_serializer()
 7    elif base_format == SerializationFormat.MSGPACK:
 8        base_serializer = create_msgpack_serializer()
 9    elif base_format == SerializationFormat.PICKLE:
10        base_serializer = PickleSerializer()
11    else:
12        base_serializer = BinarySerializer()
13
14    return CompressionSerializer(base_serializer, compression_type, compression_level)
